content: #9125 Is this a matter of removing display: none of #userlist-toggle in right-sidebar.css?
I've seen the referenced on github, although it's a fairly old discussion. We're looking to hide the users list. More for https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/18736 but hiding would do too.

@Matt While at some level this is just an UI issue and it could be hidden (it is on narrow windows), in your case are you wanting to avoid exposing user presence (mainly as per that issue), user names more generally (interactions with known particular users, perhaps), or some other reason? Even if this part of the UI is changed then the data is typically present in the web app (eg. for autocompleting mentions) or acccessed via the API, so it depends what you're trying to achieve - and how strongly that data is to be hidden away in your ideal case.

It's a bit of both really @Neil Pilgrim (neiljp) . Initially just hiding the list will be a good stop-gap but generally, we'd like to not expose users to other users unless they share a stream with them.
Knowledge of their existence? Or to avoid eg. sending PMs?
The former would be great but the latter is a primary reason.

We could obviously turn off PMs but that then limits everyones ability. Even if that feature was able to be set to admins/mods only, still could limit a genuine need for admin/mods to message members/guests
I'm not sure on the status of #18110, but that could be close to what you want, at least as a first step?
Others may know more on the plans here.
13656 sounds certainly like a solution but looks like it has been open a fair while, so not sure if that is still in active progress.
@Sahil Batra Is this anything you know about?

That PR has major work, but I think the contributor is not active as of now.
Regarding the issue in general, I think there were some decisions that need to be taken if we add more options, but I think the admins only option can still be done quickly.
Matt The issue is more tracking the overall feature set, so the age of that issue doesn't reflect partial solutions like that PR :+1:
